attributes.action: Kenyan government and people cannot effectively fight the Al Shabaab when their top leaders are forced to spend weeks in The Hague
attributes.additional_details: Given our historical relationship with Kenya, Britain should use its unique position in the world as a veto member of the Security Council, NATO, the EU, Commonwealth, major share holder in the IMF and World Bank, and the “special” relationship with the USA to rally support for the African Union call for President Uhuru Kenyatta and vice president William Ruto to be tried in Kenya.
